prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you enjoy participating in, and what topics do you typically discuss or read about in these spaces?
What other subjects outside of business do you find intriguing, and what specific aspects of these topics do you enjoy exploring?
I like doing ethnographic research on target audiences
Can you share some of your favorite hobbies or activities that you enjoy in your free time, and how do these interests influence what you choose to read online?
I like doing research. I'm a curious person. I research business topics.

What types of literature, news, or educational content do you typically consume online that satiates your curiosity and fuels your research interests, and why do these particular sources appeal to you?
Stuff about business intrigues me. I always like to read business case studies. These appeal to me because I find them interesting.
What specific industries or sectors within the business world do you find most fascinating, and can you share any recent articles or case studies you've read that particularly piqued your interest?
Marketing is one sector in business I find interesting. There was a case study about how a company went from 3K to 36K in revenue from facebook ads.
What other marketing strategies or campaigns, aside from Facebook ads, have you found intriguing in your research, and why do these particular strategies or campaigns stand out to you?
I heard about a Linkedin strategy that was good but I don't know the details on that. The ethnographic approach is also fascinating.
Can you elaborate on your interest in ethnographic approaches within marketing, and how you apply or plan to apply this knowledge in your research or professional endeavors?
I apply ethnography to marketing by observing target audiences in their natural habitats.

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
